answerText: "The Gentleman from San Francisco"[10] "The Gentleman from San Francisco" was written by Ivan Bunin in this language. Other short stories in this language include "Alyosha the Pot" and "How Much Land Does a Man Need?" by Leo Tolstoy.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 6 | 6 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The title character of this story was planning to vacation in Europe for two years with his wife and daughter. For 10 points each: [10] Name this story about an unnamed man who travels to Naples and then dies of a heart attack on Capri and returns to America in a coffin.
